parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "SLURM",
  "details": {
    "software": [
      "longshot",
      "bcftools",
      "bgzip",
      "grep",
      "cat"
    ],
    "resources": {
      "account": "rpp-rieseber",
      "time": "2-10",
      "cpus-per-task": 1,
      "mem-per-cpu": "8G",
      "modules": [
        "nixpkgs/16.09",
        "gcc/7.3.0",
        "bcftools/1.10.2"
      ]
    },
    "input_files": [
      "Sequel.RunS142_S2.002.ANN1372-3.ccs_NGMLR_bq_t.bam",
      "Ha412HOv2.0-20181130.fasta",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-301.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-302.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-303.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-304.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-305.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-306.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-307.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-308.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-309.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-310.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-311.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-312.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-313.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-314.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-315.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-316.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-317.vcf"
    ],
    "output_files": [
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-301.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-302.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-303.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-304.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-305.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-306.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-307.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-308.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-309.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-310.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-311.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-312.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-313.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-314.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-315.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-316.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-317.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-all_NH_PASS.vcf",
      "Ha412HO_ANN1372-all_PASS_WH_NGMLR.vcf.gz"
    ]
  }
}
```

This script uses SLURM to manage the execution of the code. It utilizes tools like `longshot`, `bcftools`, `bgzip`, `grep`, and `cat` to perform variant calling and merging of VCF files. The script is set up to run on a cluster, utilizing resources from the "rpp-rieseber" account with specific time, CPU, and memory requirements. The `--array` flag in the SLURM directives indicates that the script will be run in parallel for each of the 17 array tasks, which will likely be assigned to different nodes on the cluster.
